author: H Nickel

text:
I loved this game too! I played with different strangers right through...and while that made some of the challenges tough, it was so worth the challenge. I loved every second even when pulling a couple of people through. The only downside to the game is that you can't play with people from other regions.
Great soundtrack! My favourite is in the costume shop (can't remember the name of it now). It shocked me so much that I had to re-listen...over and over ;).

author: Angel L

text: First
author: Travis Johnson

text: We kick off my Top 10 games of 2015 with one of the very few handheld games I played this year. I played through this with 2 friends and once it was over, I was surprised with how much I enjoyed it and how many memorable moments we had. Surprised partly because the reviews I had seen were generally quite down on the game. It turns out the stacking/totem mechanic is great, making for fun puzzles and boss fights. The fact that the engine is based on A Link Between Worlds means that the graphics are vibrant and the gameplay is super smooth. The quality soundtrack (as always with Nagamatsu) is a nice bonus, with this theme being my highlight. Good fun with this one!
author: SupraDarky

text: +SupraDarky I think the reviews were mostly painted in the light of when you play the game on any situation that doesn't involve your friends. Single Player for many can be a slog trying to control all 3 Links and playing online is extremely hit and miss on if all 3 players are enjoyable partners. However yes, if you and 2 friends can get together then it's an amazing game.
author: Arc13

text: +SupraDarky This is probably my second favorite song from this game, especially the 3 totem stacked version.
author: Noah Hughes

text: +SupraDarky Most of the reviews only focused on single-player (shame as the multi-player is fun; plus, considering Nintendo was marketing it in the same vein as Four Swords & Four Swords Adventures, reviewers should have known what they were getting into). Personally, I played this with friends (and even random people online, at conventions, etc) and loved every minute of it!
author: Capitalist

text:
@Capitalist
Despite what almost everyone says, my least favorite part is playing online, I'd rather play the challenges single player and do coliseum with friends.
author: Noah Hughes
